title: Can I use my phone as a USB flash drive?
answer:
When you connect your phone to a computer using a USB cable, the computer identifies the microSD card and the internal storage rather than the phone memory. 

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=110916) ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=110917)

 Device file manager (MTP): exchanges media files, such as pictures, audio clips, movies, with a computer that supports MTP. 

 USB flash drive: exchanges images with a computer, an optional sharing method for a computer that does not support MTP. 

 PC Suite (HiSuite): enables the connection with HiSuite installed on your computer. With HiSuite, you can manage photos, songs, messages, and contacts on your phone as well as install or uninstall applications on or from your phone. 

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=110918)

 [When your phone is connected to a Mac in MTP mode, you can manage files on your phone, but the dial-up connection function on the Mac is unavailable. ]()
